title: CoDEC-Data
text: Like namesake, CoDEC encodes data streams communities live common format using census tract month can decoded different community-level geographies different time frames. CoDEC relies cincy R package define Cincinnati-area geographies interpolate area-level data census tracts, neighborhoods, ZIP codes different years.  Data packages created transparently reproducibly using code assemble data automatically validate data structures. single point data consumption provides ownership process harmonizing data integrates well data governance, importantly, can provide data consumed multiple ways (e.g., dashboard, tabular data file, API). Creating maintaining open community-level data resource equips entire community data-powered decision making boosts organizational trustworthiness. Demonstrating reliability capability appropriately managing shared data helps earn trust organizations communities intended served.

title: CoDEC-Data
text: Several publicly available community-maintained data sources adapted integrate CoDEC standards. Click latest release badge information data package, including source code metadata.

title: CoDEC-Data
text: Data people sharing data, privacy spectrum tradeoffs risks benefits individuals populations. Data collected individual-level one organization often shared another organization due legal restrictions organization-specific data governance policies. often interested community-level (e.g. neighborhood, census tract, ZIP code) data disaggregated gender, race, sensitive attributes. Achieving data harmonization upstream storage allows contribution disaggregated, community-level data without disclosing individual-level data sharing across organizations. White House’s Equitable Data Working Group defined equitable data “allow rigorous assessment extent government programs policies yield consistently fair, just, impartial treatment individuals.” advise equitable data “illuminate opportunities targeted actions result demonstrably improved outcomes underserved communities.” group recommended make disaggregated data norm “… intentional data collected shared, well data protected exacerbate vulnerability members underserved communities, many face heightened risk harm privacy protected.” U.S. Chief Data Scientist, Denice Ross, declared “open data necessary sufficient drive type action need create equitable society.” Open data can fall short driving action equitable. Disaggregating data sensitive attributes, like race ethnicity, can elucidate inequities otherwise remain hidden.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Cole Brokamp. Author, maintainer. Erika Manning. Author. Andrew Vancil. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Brokamp C, Manning E, Vancil (2024). codec: Community Data Explorer Cincinnati. R package version 2.0.0.9100, http://geomarker.io/codec/, https://github.com/geomarker-io/codec.
code: @Manual{,   title = {codec: Community Data Explorer for Cincinnati},   author = {Cole Brokamp and Erika Manning and Andrew Vancil},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 2.0.0.9100,     http://geomarker.io/codec/},   url = {https://github.com/geomarker-io/codec}, }

title: Community Data Explorer for Cincinnati
text: Community Data Explorer Cincinnati (CoDEC) data repository composed equitable, community-level data Cincinnati. Data communities live come different spatiotemporal resolutions extents often designed specific goal integrating data. CoDEC defines specifications community-level data effort make FAIR. Operating common data specification means organizations can easily use methods tools harmonizing, storing, accessing, sharing community-level data. data can described, curated, checked CoDEC specifications using codec R package. Using tools, collection extant community-level data resources automatically transformed harmonized, community-level data package openly available accompanied (1) richly-documented data catalog, (2) web-based interface exploring learning data, (3) API accessing data scale demand.

title: as_codec_dpkg — as_codec_dpkg
text: Convert tibble data package (dpkg) object R checking CoDEC data specifications:

title: as_codec_dpkg — as_codec_dpkg
code: as_codec_dpkg(   x,   name,   version,   title = character(),   description = character(),   homepage = character() )

title: as_codec_dpkg — as_codec_dpkg
text: x data.frame tibble meeting CoDEC data specifications name see dpkg::as_dpkg() version see dpkg::as_dpkg() title see dpkg::as_dpkg() description see dpkg::as_dpkg() homepage see dpkg::as_dpkg()

title: as_codec_dpkg — as_codec_dpkg
text: dpkg object

title: as_codec_dpkg — as_codec_dpkg
text: data must include census tract identifier column (.e., census_tract_id_2000, census_tract_id_2010, census_tract_id_2020). column must contain 11-digit GEOID identifiers every census tract Hamilton County, OH. data includes year column (year), integer year representing vintage data (e.g. 2021). data can optionally include month column (month), integer month year. Data must structured tidy format row observation specific census tract specific year (month).

title: About the CoDEC package — codec-package
text: CoDEC data package specifications provide set patterns designed make sharing tabular community-level data easier. Examples type data include pediatric hospitalization rate per month per census tract, total number gunshots per season per neighborhood, housing code enforcement density per year per ZIP code. Data specified average values total counts census tract geographies specific year (year month). required census tract identifer year (year month) columns CoDEC TDR contain spatiotemporal information can used link data.

title: About the CoDEC package — codec-package
text: Maintainer: Cole Brokamp cole.brokamp@gmail.com Authors: Erika Manning Andrew Vancil

title: CoDEC colors — codec_colors
text: CoDEC colors

title: CoDEC colors — codec_colors
text: n numeric vector color numbers character vector color names; NULL returns named vector available colors

title: CoDEC colors — codec_colors
code: plot(1:8, rep(1, 8), col = codec_colors(1:8),   pch = 19, cex = 10, axes = FALSE, xlab = "", ylab = "") text(1:8, rep(1.1, 8), labels = names(codec_colors()))

what: Put a dpkg into the public CoDEC S3 bucket — codec_dpkg_s3_put
title: Put a dpkg into the public CoDEC S3 bucket — codec_dpkg_s3_put
text: AWS CLI tool must installed authenticated write s3://geomarker-io/codec_data. resulting data package available publicly.

title: Put a dpkg into the public CoDEC S3 bucket — codec_dpkg_s3_put
Put a dpkg into the public CoDEC S3 bucket — codec_dpkg_s3_put
text: x data package (dpkg) object, ideally created as_codec_dpkg() ensure data meets CoDEC specifications

title: Put a dpkg into the public CoDEC S3 bucket — codec_dpkg_s3_put
text: character string URI uploaded resource

title: Put a dpkg into the public CoDEC S3 bucket — codec_dpkg_s3_put
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # use aws command line to login interactively via profile sso account" system2("aws", c("sso", "login", "--profile", "geomarker-io")) # make sure to set AWS_PROFILE so the AWS CLI tool knows to use it by default" Sys.setenv("AWS_PROFILE" = "geomarker-io") } # }

what: Read a dpkg from the public CoDEC repository into R — get_codec_dpkg
title: Read a dpkg from the public CoDEC repository into R — get_codec_dpkg
text: Public data packages downloaded gh://geomarker-io/codec/ using dpkg::stow() cache local copy user's data directory.

title: Read a dpkg from the public CoDEC repository into R — get_codec_dpkg
Read a dpkg from the public CoDEC repository into R — get_codec_dpkg
text: codec_dpkg name CoDEC dpkg overwrite logical; re-download remote file even though local file name exists?

title: Read a dpkg from the public CoDEC repository into R — get_codec_dpkg
text: CoDEC data package (see dpkg::as_dpkg())

title: Read a dpkg from the public CoDEC repository into R — get_codec_dpkg
code: get_codec_dpkg("drivetime-v0.2.2") #> # [☰] drivetime-v0.2.2 #> # title: "Average Drive Time to Cincinnati Children's" #> # homepage: https://geomarker.io/codec #> # ℹ Use `dpkg_meta() to get all metadata #> # A tibble: 222 × 3 #>    census_tract_id_2010 drive_time_avg  year #>    <chr>                         <dbl> <dbl> #>  1 39061000200                    18    2024 #>  2 39061000700                    13    2024 #>  3 39061000900                    12.9  2024 #>  4 39061001000                    12    2024 #>  5 39061001100                    12    2024 #>  6 39061001600                    12    2024 #>  7 39061001700                    12    2024 #>  8 39061001800                    12    2024 #>  9 39061001900                    12    2024 #> 10 39061002000                    12.4  2024 #> #
